12_11ecbplus_0_2_2.raw: 1: Elaboration: #foils# refers to the action of the warship INS Sukanya, an Indian Navy ship, on November 10, 2011, preventing a piracy attempt in the Gulf of Aden, located between Somalia and Yemen. The warship was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor (IRTC) when it intercepted five boats targeting the merchant vessels. The warship managed to carry out boarding and search operations on three of the boats, seizing weapons and pirate equipment, and detaining 26 Somalian crewmen.

34_10ecbplus_0_1_1.raw: Elaboration: #nominates# refers to the action taken by President Barack Obama on July 13, 2009, to propose Regina Benjamin, a 52-year-old rural family doctor in Alabama and a 2008 MacArthur Foundation Fellow, for the position of the new surgeon general. Benjamin, who was the first black woman on the American Medical Association's board of trustees and the first AMA trustee to be elected before the age of 40, is known for her work at the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic, which she founded in 1990. The clinic serves a largely uninsured working-class community that was hit by Hurricanes Katrina and George. If confirmed by the Senate, Benjamin will replace Rear Admiral Steven K. Galson, who has been acting surgeon general since October 2007.
